channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: If millions of dead people are stealing from Social Security, then why can’t the DOJ find any of them?
item.description: Why the ‘dead people collecting Social Security’ narrative just won’t die

item.title: This is the future of senior housing
item.description: Older consumers — and their adult children — now have more education and higher technological expectations.

item.title: ForwardX new self-production facility to produce 5,000 mobile robots per year
item.description: With a high annual production capacity, ForwardX said the factory is well-positioned to meet the increasing demand for robotics systems. The post Forw...

item.title: Trump backs off on electronics tariffs
item.description: Reacting to continuing stock market woes and perhaps tech industry lobbyin, Trump backed off on tariffs for electronics late last night.

item.title: Bigger isn’t always better: Examining the business case for multi-million token LLMs
item.description: Are we unlocking new frontiers in AI reasoning, or simply stretching the limits of token memory without meaningful improvements?

item.title: My cousin died before receiving our uncle’s $2M inheritance. Will the rest of the family receive this money instead?
item.description: “His trust named his son as the only beneficiary of his home and had no alternate beneficiaries.”

item.title: Why does Trump love those ‘beautiful’ tariffs? It didn’t start with China.
item.description: “Make America Great Again” longs for an America that can never be again.

item.title: How the ‘trade of the year’ in the bond market became a nightmare for investors after Trump’s tariffs
item.description: Here is what’s at stake as a lesser-known “basis trade” came undone this week, just before President Trump’s mini-pivot on tariffs.

item.title: Now it’s TikTok parent ByteDance’s turn for a reasoning AI: enter Seed-Thinking-v1.5!
item.description: It achieved an 8.0% higher win rate over DeepSeek R1, suggesting that its strengths generalize beyond just logic or math-heavy challenges.
